Class Flightboard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am22new.Model.Flightboards.Flightboard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Level2FlightBoard, TutorialFlightBoard
public abstract class Flightboard extends Object implements Serializable
The Flightboard class represents a base abstraction for the game flightboard that tracks the positions of rockets and their ordered placement during the game. It provides core functionality for managing the rockets' movement, placement, and ordering. This class is intended to be extended by specific implementations of flightboards.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Flightboard

      public Flightboard(Game game, int flightBoardLength)
      Constructs a Flightboard with the given game and flight board length. Initializes an empty list of ordered rockets and an empty positions map.
      Parameters:
      game - the game associated with the flight board
      flightBoardLength - the length of the flight board

    • Flightboard

      public Flightboard(List<String> orderedRockets, Map<String,Integer> positions, int flightBoardLength)
      Constructs a Flightboard with the specified ordered list of rocket nicknames, a map of rocket positions, and the length of the flightboard.
      Parameters:
      orderedRockets - The ordered list of rocket nicknames representing their sequence on the flightboard.
      positions - The map containing the positions of rockets, where the key is the rocket's nickname and the value is its position.
      flightBoardLength - The length of the flightboard, representing the total number of valid positions.

  • Method Details

    • getOrderedRockets

      public List<String> getOrderedRockets()
      Retrieves the list of rockets ordered by their positions on the flightboard in descending order. The ordering reflects the current state of the game, where the rockets with the higher positions appear earlier in the list.
      Returns:
      A list of rocket nicknames ordered by their positions on the flightboard.

    • getPositions

      public Map<String,Integer> getPositions()
      Retrieves the current mapping of rocket nicknames to their respective positions on the flightboard. The positions indicate the rockets' locations and are represented as integer values.
      Returns:
      a map where the keys are rocket nicknames (String) and the values are their corresponding positions (Integer) on the flightboard.

    • shiftRocket

      public void shiftRocket(String nickname, int stepsBackPositive)
      Shifts a rocket's position on the flightboard based on the specified number of steps. The movement direction depends on the sign of the steps: positive steps indicate a backward shift, and negative steps indicate a forward shift.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the unique identifier of the rocket to be shifted
      stepsBackPositive - the number of steps to shift the rocket; positive for a backward shift, negative for a forward shift

    • removeRocket

      public void removeRocket(String nickname)
      Removes a rocket, identified by its unique nickname, from the flightboard. The rocket is removed from both the ordered list of rockets and the positions map that tracks their locations.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The unique identifier of the rocket to be removed.

    • placeRocket

      public abstract void placeRocket(String nickname, int pos)
      Places a rocket identified by a unique nickname at a specific position on the flightboard. The position is determined based on predefined rules or game configuration logic. Updates the rocket's placement information and adjusts the internal ordered list of rockets.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The unique identifier of the rocket to be placed.
      pos - The designated position on the flightboard where the rocket should be placed. The valid range for this parameter is determined by the specific implementation of the flightboard.

    • getFlightBoardLength

      public int getFlightBoardLength()
      Retrieves the length of the flight board.
      Returns:
      the length of the flight board, which determines the range of positions available on the board for rocket placement.

    • getStartingPositions

      public abstract List<Integer> getStartingPositions()
      Retrieves a list of starting positions represented as indexes on the flightboard. The indexes are returned in descending order of priority, where the first element corresponds to the highest priority position. For example, the first position in the list is associated with the top placement on the flightboard.
      Returns:
      A list of integers representing the indexes of starting positions on the flightboard, ordered by their priority from highest to lowest.
